pages.text: O-Cows drop lots of meat, leather, and bones. Cows can be milked to make cheese. $(br2)O-Cows naturally run from O-Horses, and herd with eachother. You can use this to your advantage to drive up to 8 cattle in a herd with your horse.
The milking cooldown on normal O-Cows is 40 minutes, whilst dairy breed cooldowns are 10 minutes. If desired, you can place a Bell on your cow(s) to keep up with it.

O-Cows come in multiple different breeds. This includes: $(br2)-(0) Angus $(br)-(1) Longhorn $(br)-(2) Brahman $(br)-(3) Mini $(br)-(4) Watusi $(br)-(5) Corriente $(br)-(6) Holstein $(br)-(7) Jersey $(br)-(8) Hereford $(br)-(9) Highland

Angus, Brahman, Watusi and Hereford cattle are meat cows, which means they generally drop more meat and are bigger. Holstein and Jersey, on the other hand, are dairy cattle, so they can give milk much faster than other cows.
